item.title: BRAC Bank hosts entrepreneur conference to promote its pioneering SME Digital Loan ‘Shafollo’
item.description: BRAC Bank recently organised an entrepreneur conference of its SME Digital Loan ‘Shafollo’ in Gazipur to showcase the country’s first SME digital loan programme. The engagement, that brought together more than 200 small and medium business owners, reinforces the bank’s comm

item.title: Md. Siddiqur Rahman takes charge as Acting Managing Director of Standard Bank
item.description: Md. Siddiqur Rahman, the Deputy Managing Director & Chief Operating Officer of the bank, has taken charge as Acting Managing Director of Standard Bank PLC, according to a press release. Mr. Rahman joined the Shari`ah-based Standard Bank as DMD in August 2023and has played a pivotal role in strengt

item.title: Karmasangsthan Bank holds business review meeting in Dhaka
item.description: Karmasangsthan Bank held a Business Review Meeting-2026 on Saturday at the conference hall of the Department of Youth Development in Motijheel, Dhaka. The meeting was attended by regional managers, branch managers, and field officers from the Dhaka, Dhaka North, and Narayanganj regions under the D

item.title: Election violence in January kills 4, injures 509 across Bangladesh: MSF
item.description: At least four people have been killed and 509 others injured in 64 incidents of election-related violence across Bangladesh in January, according to rights group Manabadhikar Shongskriti Foundation (MSF). The figures come amid reports of clashes between activists of the BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami in

item.title: Explosion occurs at Iran's southern port of Bandar Abbas
item.description: An explosion occurred at Iran's southern port of Bandar Abbas on Saturday, Iranian media reported, without giving a cause for the blast. The semi-official Tasnim news agency said that social media reports alleging that a Revolutionary Guard navy commander was targeted in the explosion were "comple

item.title: Islami Bank holds employee conference for 3 zones, 5 corporate branches in Dhaka
item.description: Islami Bank Bangladesh PLC is the largest bank in the country and the employees should make efforts to further increase public confidence in this institution. item.title: Pakistan says 67 militants killed after coordinated attacks in Balochistan
item.description: At least 67 militants were killed on Saturday as they battled Pakistan's security forces in multiple cities across the southwestern province of Balochistan, four security officials told Reuters. Some 10 police and security personnel and 11 civilians were also killed during the orchestrated militan

item.title: Cubans under siege as US stranglehold sets in
item.description: Cubans from all walks of life are hunkering into survival mode, navigating lengthening blackouts and soaring prices for food, fuel and transport as the US threatens a stranglehold on the communist-run nation. Reuters interviewed over three dozen residents of towns and neighbourhoods around the cap

item.title: Diploma engineers block train and roads over quota demand in Gazipur
item.description: Diploma engineers and students blocked railway tracks and roads in Gazipur on Saturday to protest the 33 percent quota for BSc engineers in the recruitment of sub-assistant engineers and to press their five-point demands. The protest disrupted train services to northern districts when demonstrator

item.title: Railways put on high alert before polls
item.description: With the parliamentary election and referendum approaching, the Ministry of Railways has ordered authorities to take the highest level of precaution to protect passengers, trains, and railway infrastructure. The directive, issued on Saturday, emphasised that “self-interested groups may attem

item.title: Election result delay beyond 12 hours to signal dishonest intent: Mirza Abbas
item.description: BNP senior leader and party-nominated candidate for Dhaka-8 Mirza Abbas on Saturday said any delay beyond 12 hours in announcing the upcoming national election results would indicate dishonest intentions. “I have heard it may take a long time to announce the results. item.title: Jamaat’s tactics before election threaten national interest: Tarique
item.description: Accusing Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami of misleading voters through unethical practices, BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman on Saturday warned that those who resort to such tactics before an election can ‘sell the country’ if given a chance to come to power. “I want to warn everyone that s
